Description: Victory seated holding a plaque with the bust of Lord Nelson, a lion, palm-tree and harp in front of a pyramid. (obverse)
Curator's comments: Brown 1980 states: The date on the reverse of this medal is possibly an error for Nelson's birth date, 29th September. The 'Gentleman's Magazine' records that prayers were offered for the victory in St Paul's Cathedral on 21st October 1798 and the following two Sundays. See also Brown 1p106.447. Bibliography: Milford Haven, Admiral the Marquis of. 'British Naval Medals', London, 1919, 484; Sandwich, The Rt. Hon. the Earl of. 'British and Foreign medals relating to naval and maritime affairs', 2nd ed., London, 1950, N/3.
Bibliographic references: Brown 1980 / A catalogue of British historical medals 1760-1960, vol.I: the accession of George III to the death of William IV (p109.450)
Associated names: Portrait of: Horatio Nelson, 1st Baron and Viscount Nelson
Associated events: Commemoration of: Battle of the Nile,1798
